result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Bozich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 92 days credit.  Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.   Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Fine.  PAID IN FULL.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost.  PAID IN FULL.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with any victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence. 

Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Commencing forthwith.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 08/01/22 requesting extended hours of release for employment purposes.

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 08-11-2022: Please amend JOC to reflect, court has no objection to Huber release up to 14 hours per day for work.**
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia
Bail applied to Fines/Costs in 22CF486, 22CF428, 22CF518, 22CF786.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

02:05 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Cases 22CF518 and 22CF786. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  26 MONTHS
Initial Confinement: 13 MONTHS
Extended Supervision: 13 MONTHS
92 Days Credit if revoked.
Concurrent to:  any other sentence.

STAYED for PROBATION

IF revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint or her residence.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $ 656.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

CONDITION TIME: 80 DAYS Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.   Defendant to commence serving today (defendant currently in custody)  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Any monies posted on this matter to be applied toward costs/surcharge in this matter and towards case 22CF428.  Any monies over to be refunded to poster.  

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Ricardo Tapia
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen
Hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is to comply with all conditions in Waukesha County Case 22CF428 which are as follows:  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not to use any social media to include SnapChat and Facebook.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

02:35 PM Defendant James H Bozich in court, in custody.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states Attorney Ricardo Tapia represents him on his other matter.  Attorney Cassandra Miller appears as a friend of the Court.  Court sets matter for a status of counsel date next week to ensure the defendant still qualifies.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
